definition: clear dividing line/to distinguish clearly
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: I struggle to set boundaries. I put myself last.
sentences.chinese: 我挣扎着去划清界限并把自己放在最后一位。

sentences.english: But most private agencies are eager to draw a line with property companies.
sentences.chinese: 但多数私人房检员都急于跟这些地产商划清界限。

sentences.english: I chose to be dis-fellowshipped and became officially unaffiliated with the church.
sentences.chinese: 最后我选择了退会，正式与教会划清关系。

sentences.english: How will insurance policies be updated or investment portfolios unmingled?
sentences.chinese: 如何更新保险单，或者划清组合投资？

sentences.english: Secondly, we must make clear the scope of responsibilities between the community committees and other community organizations.
sentences.chinese: 二要划清社区居委会与其他社区组织的职责范围。

sentences.english: We must make a clear distinction between this crime and the similar for convicting it.
sentences.chinese: 为正确认定本罪，应划清本罪与近似犯罪的区别。

sentences.english: I can feel anger now, but I draw the line at resentment.
sentences.chinese: 我现在可以感觉到生气了，但我把它跟愤恨划清界限。

sentences.english: They are of the old school of thought that advocates for clear-cut lines between design and development.
sentences.chinese: 他们是守旧派，倡导在设计和开发之间划清界限。

definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
limits/bounds/dividing line
to say a matter has no relationship with the individual referred to, to emphasise one is innocent or in the clear
boundary
unclear/ambiguous/having an unclear relationship with
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
connection/association/involvement
to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
to rip one's robe as a sign of repudiating a sworn brotherhood (idiom)/to break all friendly ties
to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
